lenders.name: Josh
lenders.occupational_info:
What's going on everybody?! Welcome to Rockin' 4 Wishes! We're extremely excited about planning our upcoming events so that each and everyone of you can have the opportunity to be involved with every single aspect of Rockin' 4 Wishes just as much as us two...Joshua James Handy & Stephen Barrell. Our dream with Rockin' 4 Wishes will continue on and will never stop until we achieve nothing but success! From this day forward, we will commit to raising $1,000,000 to grant wishes for all people who have life threatening illnesses, live their lives handicapped, live in poverty, and for people that have always wanted their greatest wish in life and could never have it due to a financial limitation.


Rockin' 4 Wishes is an organization that hosts promotional concerts events that raise awareness and funds to grant wishes for people with the ailments described above. Bringing in a demographic of people who love and appreciate music combined with the love and appreciation that people have for helping one another is the unique concept that is the driving force of what makes Rockin' 4 Wishes an amazing experience for all who becomes involved!


YOU can be the difference, YOU can lend a helping hand, YOU hold the key in helping Rockin' 4 Wishes make a difference in people lives..."Helping the World One Person at a Time..." is not easy. Please get in touch and let us know of anyone that has any type condition that is preventing them from having their one wish in life... We can guarantee that you’ll always be remembered for contributing to the belief in Rockin' 4 Wishes. Enjoy the music from our live performers, pay attention to show updates…we’re going to rock the world…welcome all!

lenders.name: Natasha
lenders.occupation: Diversity Training Facilitator, and Business Owner
lenders.loan_because:
I live in St. John's, Newfoundland, Canada, and I have also lived in various cities across Canada as well as in Ireland and South Korea. I have a passion for traveling and learning about other cultures and was blessed with the opportunity to host a travel TV show in Kenya, Africa. 

I enjoy many things, but at the top of my list: the outdoors, the local coffee shop, being a friend of the environment, volunteering, personal development adventures, yoga, and just plain ol' enjoying life.  I have a very blessed existence and I want to share my fortune. 

Goals and ambitions are motivating and important in a person's life. I have a goal of living a sustainable life, giving back to the earth what I take; I dream of being a mother one day and adopting internationally, and I aspire to work with youth and volunteer overseas. Kiva gives me the chance to connect overseas and share with other hardworking and dedicated entrepreneurs. 

I've been fortunate to accomplish many things in my life. But my biggest accomplishment: my resilience. I have created a fulfilling life for myself, a passion for adventure and a desire to make a difference. 

Cheers to Kiva.org and to Bill Clinton who so graciously introduced me to this organization.
lenders.occupational_info:
I am the Coordinator of the Diversity Education Initiative at the Association for New Canadians. I work towards creating a more inclusive community by offering workshops and info sessions on Discrimination and Accomodation and Respectful and Inclusive Workplaces. I also spend time in schools speaking with students and teachers on how to welcome newcomers into their classrooms. I am always looking for new and innovative ways to welcome and celebrate diversity.

I'm having the time of my life right now by living my dream of owning my own business. I am an independant distributor of Xocai - the healthy chocolate. It has given me an answer, a solution to the things I have wanted in my life.

lenders.name: MARTHA LUCIA
lenders.loan_because: Solicito el prestamo porque estoy interesada en elaborar proyectos encausados en la creación de microempresas para que mis alumnos sean autosuficientes.  Para ello hay diferentes ideas en las cuales me gustaría que ustedes conocieran y apoyaran
lenders.occupational_info: Elaboracion de proyectos viables para la cosntitucion de microempresas para que mis alumnos sean autosuficientes, ya que son estudiantes tecnicos de bajos recursos, en los cuales mi aporte es la construccion de sus ideas

lenders.name: Wain
lenders.loan_because: I believe it helps people to help themselves and kiva gives me confidence that the money goes to the right place
lenders.occupational_info: I write software for helicopters, banks, mobile phones and desktop computers

lenders.name: Ariel

lenders.name: Monique and Chris
lenders.loan_because: It's Biblical.  Why not give people access to life-changing loans?
lenders.occupational_info: i'm a writer!

lenders.name: Ilse
lenders.loan_because: I like small organisations where you can choose yourself what people you want to help. And that I myself can help people to have a better life. In the Western World we have so much, and it is good to share.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student, and on my free saturday I work at the post. So I spend my day with delivering mail to people's houses.

lenders.name: Adam
lenders.loan_because: I've been blessed by many gifts in my life - many opportunities that others in the world have been denied. I believe it is my responsibility to share my blessings with others.
lenders.occupational_info: I design and build websites - particularly high-end, cutting edge sites using some of the newest technologies available.

lenders.name: Laurie
lenders.loan_because: I want to do it! Go Chickens!
lenders.occupational_info: My husband is a chemistry teacher. I am home with our two teenagers and I'm in college to become a teacher. I spend a lot of time with my elderly mother too.

lenders.name: Pamela
lenders.loan_because: I am happy to know that the little bit of financial assistance I am able to offer can make a large impact for individuals and groups who are trying to find ways to support themselves and their families.
lenders.occupational_info: Coordinate research project for the University of California San Francisco Multiple Sclerosis Genetics Group. Researchers are attempting to identify the genes and alleles that make a person susceptible to developing Multiple Sclerosis and to better understand the disease process of this condition. Over 500 MS patients participate annually in the study that I coordinate which began in 2004.

lenders.name: Jens
lenders.loan_because: It's a great way to empower people to realize their own ideas and maybe even little or big dreams.

lenders.name: Melissa
lenders.loan_because: I want to make the world a better place. I lend to honor the cherished memory of my father, who believed in helping those who needed it.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach English and work at a financial institution

lenders.name: Paulo
lenders.loan_because: I can and therefore I must!
lenders.occupational_info: I design medical equipment using 100% recycled materials.

lenders.name: Ewan
lenders.loan_because: Having successfully overcome epilepsy through surgery (the non religious way), I feel I should give something back to society as I am now living life at a higher level than was expected of me.
lenders.occupational_info: The day job involves accounting for foreign exchange transactions of multi national corporations. My real interest lies in industrial heritage, an area where I maintain my own website.

lenders.loan_because: I read about this program in the New York Times magazine--an interview with (I forget). It seemed a perfect way to contribute, other than with local hands-on activities.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired but am active in an international students' homestay program with a local university. I've also taken up drawing/painting for the umpteenth time and hope to finally say "I'm an artist" with conviction.
